description: A live recording of The Londown podcast from Open City, with architect Nana Biamah-Ofosu, opinion editor Hettie O’Brien and journalist and broadcaster Merlin Fulcher.

factsheet.heading: Event Details
paragraphs:
The Londown Live with Nana Biamah-Ofosu and Hettie O’Brien
3pm Saturday 13 November
Clore Studio, South London Gallery, 65 Peckham Rd, London SE5 8UH
£8
Complimentary refreshments included.

factsheet.heading: Event Description
paragraphs:
A live recording of The Londown podcast from Open City, with architect Nana Biamah-Ofosu, opinion editor Hettie O’Brien and journalist and broadcaster Merlin Fulcher.
Join the studio audience for a special recording of the award-winning Londown podcast at the South London Gallery on Saturday 13 November. Includes complimentary refreshments.

Merlin Fulcher and special guests Nana Biamah-Ofosu and Hettie O’Brien will review the week’s biggest London architecture news.
Hear fresh takes on the latest controversies and contribute to the recording itself as live studio audience in this pioneering new format.
The Londown is produced in association with the Architects’ Journal and won Best Podcast at 2021 Archiboo Awards.

factsheet.heading: Host Bios
paragraphs: Nana Biamah-Ofosu is director of Studio NYALI, unit master of Diploma 6 at the Architectural Association, and lecturer in architecture at Kingston School of Art. Nana was part of the second cohort of New Architecture Writers and her written work has been published in the UK architectural press as well as internationally.

Merlin Fulcher is Open House Worldwide Tours Director and host of The Londown podcast. Merlin is also competitions editor, focussing on procurement, for both Architects' Journal and Architectural Review.

Hettie O’Brien is assistant opinion editor at the Guardian and former online editor at the New Statesman. Hettie grew up in Peckham, south east London. Hettie previously worked as a reporter in Washington DC covering the federal trade commission and as a researcher at Rethinking Economics.

name: The Londown Live with Nana Biamah-Ofosu and Hettie O’Brien
